Jul 18, 2009: Pre-natal Prana Vinyasa Flow at Tranquil Space Yoga Arlington
properties.description:
pre-natal prana vinyasa flow: embrace your inner goddess & let the belly go with Jodi Darlage
a pregnant woman's challenge is learning to slow down, let go & embrace change in the body as positive and amazingly magnificent. experience doing less and allow the meditative, bhakti yoga space to blossom. we will explore a mindful & creative mandala vinyasa flow practice that embraces your inner shakti. yoginis will learn modifications for the pregnant goddess while instinctively connecting to the new life growing within you. our vinyasa flow will strengthen the legs, open the hips and calm the mind -all to prepare the body for the beauty of birth. 
our practice will end with a long & restorative savasana. this workshop is designed for the practicing yogini who wants to learn how to maintain & modify her current practice as a pregnant goddess. in 2008, jodi received additional pre & post- natal teacher training with shiva rea.

properties.title: Dec 22, 2009: Free screening of "Sacred Space Denied: Bethlehem and the Wall" at Arlington Central Library
properties.description: Bethlehem, located near Jerusalem in the West Bank, is one of the most historically significant towns in Israel/Palestine. It is known as the birthplace of King David and Jesus. For generations, it was a lively and bustling town. Today, however, Bethlehem resembles an open-air prison, occupied by Israel's military and encircled by Israel's separation wall. These circumstances have caused Bethlehem's citizens, particularly its once-vibrant Christian population, to emigrate from the city in substantial numbers. On December 22, 2009, from 7:00 PM – 8:30 PM at the Arlington Central Library, the American Association for Palestinian Equal Rights (AAPER) is hosting a free screening of “Sacred Space Denied: Bethlehem and the Wall,” to be followed by an informal group discussion. The film is a short documentary examining the situation on the ground in Bethlehem today. This event is being held as part of AAPER’s Free Bethlehem Campaign, to raise awareness of this aspect of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict, and to foster debate oriented at obtaining lasting peace for both sides. Come enjoy a night of lively debate and fresh perspectives in a stimulating environment. Although admission is free, we ask that, for logistical purposes, you RSVP to afroh3000@yahoo.com so that we may plan accordingly. Feel free to submit questions and comments also. The event will be held in the Second Floor Meeting Room of the Arlington Central Library, which is located at 1015 North Quincy Street, Arlington, VA 22201-4661.

Feb 26, 2010: Sol & Funk Root at the LA Bar in Arlington VA at L.A. Bar
properties.description:
Sol has performed around the world with roots and r&b legends, and performs a unique mix of funk, blues, rock, and reggae original songs, as well as a few tasty covers. His CD Freedom includes musicians that that toured with Jah Works, Corey Harris, Ana Popovic, Squirrel Nut Zippers, Hobex, and more.
Sol is bringing a cast of highly talented musicians to a local DC metro area venue. Sol works with the incredibly solid drummer Scott Rabino (of Tommy Castro, Idle Americans, Billy Woodward) and deep groove bassist Mike Tony Echols (of Mary Ann Redmond, Bobby Thompson, Politicks). Also saxophonist Eli Gonzalez (of the Texas Chainsaw Horns), recently back from a music tour overseas to support the US tours, is rumored to be stopping by to be a part of the show!
LA Bar is a Arlington neighborhood venue that prides itself on its relaxed atmosphere, and has only recently dedicated itself to bringing in high quality DC area bands. LA Bar has a special Friday Night Music Series as well as a Thursday night Music Showcase and Open Jam. Music kicks off at 9:30 pm. FREE admission.
"Sol is an exceptional guitarist & a great musician/songwriter who constantly reinvents himself with an extraordinary ability to fit the perfect approach and composition."- Fred Cannon, a Senior VP at BMI
"a heavy groove! Sol tears out funk, blues, and reggae, delivered with deep soul" - T. Duffy President Music Maker

properties.title: Mar  3, 2010: Wednesday Wake-Up Club Breakfast at Leadership Institute
properties.description: Host: The Leadership Institute. Larry Pratt has been Executive Director of Gun Owners of America for 20 years. GOA is a national membership organization of 150 thousand Americans dedicated to promoting their second amendment freedom to keep and bear Arms. GOA lobbies for the pro-gun position in Washington and is involved in firearms issues in the states. Mr. Pratt has appeared on numerous national radio and TV programs such as CNN’s Crossfire and Larry King Live, CBS’s 48 Hours, ABC’s Peter Jennings’. He has debated Congressmen James Traficant, Jr. (D-OH), Charles Rangel (D-NY), and Senator Howard Metzenbaum (D-OH), among others. Mr. Pratt published a book, Armed People Victorious, in 1990 and was editor of a book, Safeguarding Liberty The Constitution & Citizen Militias, in 1995.

properties.title: Feb 21, 2010: Workshop: the Art of Alienweeds at Long Branch Nature Center
properties.description: Join Washington Post artist Patterson Clark for an introduction to using invasive plants as an abundant source for art materials. The workshop will include a weed walk, which will identify various plant tissues that can be isolated and made into paper, inks, pens, brushes, printing blocks and cordage. The class will harvest bamboo culms and learn how to make a simple reed pen for dipping in ink. An indoor presentation will focus on several processes used to extract a bounty from exotic weeds. Participants will need to bring their own sharp pocket knife. Meet at Long Branch Nature Center, 625 S. Carlin Springs Road, Arlington, VA 22204. Call 703-228-6535 for more information.

properties.title: Feb 21, 2010: Invasive Plant Removal at Long Branch Nature Center
properties.description: Not all plants are good for the environment. Invasive plants crowd native ones out for space and light and some can even grow a "mile-a-minute"! Come learn what these troublesome beasts look like and help rescue our parks from these alien invaders! We meet monthly. If you have your own garden gloves and tools, please bring them along. Some supplies will be provided. Be sure to come dressed for work, wear sturdy shoes, long pants, long sleeves, and perhaps a hat. You may also want to bring along a reusable water bottle. Register at jtruong@vt.edu or 703-228-7636.

properties.title: Mar  5, 2010: The Light in the Piazza at Arena Stage at Arena Stage
properties.description:
One windy day in the Tuscan countryside, Clara loses her hat in a sudden gust, and as if guided by fate, it lands at the feet of the handsome Fabrizio. As their whirlwind courtship unfolds, Clara's mother, Margaret, is unable to conceal the family
secret and must reconsider not only her daughter's future but her own as well. Arena’s Artistic Director, Molly Smith directs an intimate, chamber version of this musical that won six Tony Awards (including Best Score) and hearts across the country, being hailed “a magnificent theatrical achievement” (Chicago Tribune) and “absolutely transfixing” (San Francisco Chronicle). Craig Lucas (Prelude to a Kiss) has distilled Elizabeth Spencer's novella to a poignant tale about the essence of love, aided by the lush music of Adam Guettel (Floyd Collins).
WHEN: March 5-April 11, 2010
Press Opening Night is March 11, 2010 at 8:00 p.m.
Sunday, Tuesday & Wednesday evenings at 7:30 p.m.
Thursday, Friday & Saturday evenings at 8:00 p.m.
Saturday & Sunday matinees at 2:00 p.m.
Check calendar for exceptions and weekday matinees.
TICKETS: Tickets for The Light in the Piazza range from $25-$74 plus applicablefees. Discount tickets are available for patrons purchasing tickets for multiple shows, students and groups. A limited number of $10 tickets for patrons ages 30 and under go on sale beginning each Monday for performances that week. (All patrons must present valid ID.) HOTTIX, a limited number of half-price, day-of-performance tickets, are available 90–30 minutes before curtain prior to every performance. Tickets may be purchased online at  ww.arenastage.org, by phone at (202) 488-3300 or at the Arena Stage Sales Office at 1800 S. Bell Street, Arlington, VA 22202.

properties.title: Mar 27, 2010: Recess Game Night Party & Ice Cream Social For Adults at Sheraton National Hotel
properties.description: RECESS! PLAY AND STAY AT SHERATON NATIONAL! On March 27th Host-DC and Host-NYC invite you to be a kid again and to experience Recess, the DC area's first game night for adults mixed with a party atmosphere! Relive some of your youth as attendees will be able to enjoy games, drinks, discounted rooms, and a live DJ at this month's playground the Sheraton National Hotel. Come out and have tons of fun with other DC area professionals as we laugh, play, and party at Recess! Experience why Recess has been featured in The Washington Post, Channel 9 News, The Washingtonian, Metromix, On Tap Magazine, and many other media outlets! GAMES: Nintendo Wii, Twister, Uno, Taboo, Pictureka, Scattegories, Pictionary, Jenga, Tabletop Soccer, Tabletop Hockey, Spades, Connect 4, Battleship, Sorry, Scrabble, Chess, Checkers, Life, Chutes and Ladders, Hungry Hippo, Candyland, Trouble, Operation, Guess Who, Clue, Monopoly, and more!! Large dance floor! DATE: March 27th 2010 TIME: 9pm - 1am 21+ SOUNDS: DJ J Buttah TICKET INFO: Tickets are only $10 and can be purchased by visiting http://recesshostdc.eventbrite.com. SPECIALTY DRINKS: Twistertini (10 cane rum, ground cinnamon, apple juice), Monopolized (premium belvedere orange, x-rated fusion, triple sec, orange juice), Boardwalk Smash (makers mark, muddled lemon wedges, mint, simple syrup) ICE CREAM: Remember running to catch the ice cream truck? We'll have some of your favorite old school ice cream at Recess! PICK YOUR PLAYGROUND NAME: Upon entering guests will be given a name tag and asked to pick their playground name. Be creative and have fun with it as playground names are great ice breakers! DISCOUNT ROOMS: http://www.starwoodmeeting.com/StarGroupsWeb/booking/reservation?id=1003156208&key=79514 For more info, media requests, and birthday parties contact info@host-dc.com or call 202-498-9621 Discount garage parking available at venue Follow us on Twitter: @HostDC, Twitter event hashtag #RecessHostDC PARTY LIKE AN ADULT, PLAY LIKE A KID AT RECESS!

properties.title: May 18, 2010: SharePoint 2010 Launch Event - Washington DC at Sheraton National Hotel
properties.description:
Visit IDV Solutions' booth at the SharePoint 2010 Launch Event in Washington DC!
Find out how to plan for, implement, and deploy the next wave in business productivity.
Learn what the integrated platform means for the productivity of you and your users—across PC, phone, and browser. You'll get a full day of training from Microsoft engineers, evangelists, and partners.
Here's a sampling of what you can expect:
- See how Office 2010 and SharePoint 2010 work together as an integrated platform.
- Get an introduction to the next wave of productivity via integrated platform demonstrations.
- Take home information on tools and resources that will help you plan by evaluating your current infrastructure.
- Learn about infrastructure decisions that pave the way for implementing a rich business productivity platform.
- Explore tools that can help you optimize desktop deployment.
- Additional products that will be highlighted at the event include Visio 2010, Project 2010, SQL Server 2008 R2, and Exchange Server 2010.

properties.title: May 30, 2010: Clarendon’s 3 Kicks-Off Summer with a Memorial Day Charitable Pig Roast at 3 Bar and Grill (formerly Restaurant 3)
properties.description:
The Neighborhood Bar & Grill Celebrates Summer with Craft Ales and a Whole Smoked Pig from Eco-Friendly Foods to Benefit the Leukemia & Lymphoma Society
         Nothing says “summer” like an old fashioned pig roast! To celebrate the warm weather season and seasonal opening of its patio, 3 Bar & Grill (formerly Restaurant Three) is hosting a charitable Pig Roast on Sunday, May 30 from 4 p.m until they run out of pork to raise money for the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society. Brian Robinson of 3 and Bev Eggleston of Eco-Friendly Foods will  roast the 250+ pound pig from Eco-Friendly Foods street side on Clarendon Boulevard, while the restaurant will offer drink specials from 4 p.m. – 9 p.m.
 	Drink specials include $3 Bell’s Oberon Ale, $2 Miller Lite and $5 Bacon Bloody Marys in case guests haven’t had their fill of pork for the day. Hot, smoky pulled pork sandwiches will be available for a suggested donation of $5, with all proceeds directly benefiting the Leukemia and Lymphoma Society. The public is invited to attend the community pig roast while supporting a charitable cause.

properties.title: Jul  2, 2010: Munay-ki Retreat at Arlington Neighborhoods
properties.description: The Munay-ki are the initiation rites of the medicine people of South America. They are a series of nine energy transmissions that help heal our wounds by illuminating our energy field and returning it to its original vibration that looks like a rainbow. The Muany-ki reconnect us with all of the natural world, seen and unseen, and help us reach into the universe and magic of our lives. They attune us to our divine nature and are a powerful support for anyone looking for deeper meaning in life. Each one of the rites is enough to improve your life. Together, they form a powerful way to support your enlightenment journey. During the retreat you will: 1. Receive the 9 Great Rites of Enlightenment 2. Learn how to open and close sacred space 3. Receive energetic protection and guidance 4. Be gifted a pie stone 5. Receive a detailed manual about the rites 6. Participate in fire and despacho ceremony 7. Connect with Spirit 8. Open your heart and receive deep healing 9. Align with your highest self Logistics: The Munay-Ki retreat begins Friday, July 2 at 1pm and ends Sunday, July 4 at 2pm. The retreat will be held in Arlington, VA. I will be an intimate setting with nature trails nearby. More details will be sent to registrants. Cost and Registration: $395/person. Pre-registration is required at http://luminousmedicine.com. If you are interested, but cannot make it to this retreat, please contact Luminous Warrior. What to bring: Please bring a journal and pen, layers and comfortable clothing as temperatures may vary. If you’d like to utilize one of the beautiful trails in the area, please bring a flashlight and comfortable shoes for hiking. About the facilitators: Sara Salam is a certified Master Practitioner in Energy Medicine and Luminous Healing from the Four Winds Society and an expert level self-defense instructor in the Art of Krav Maga. She holds an M.B.A. from Georgetown and has over 10 years of consulting experience. Dr. Marie Rodriguez is a licensed Naturopathic Physician who skillfully blends a variety of natural and energetic therapies to compassionately facilitate you in reaching your fullest potential. For more visit Marie’s website at http://dmarierodriguez.com.

properties.title: Jul 14, 2010: Richard II at H-B Woodlawn Mainstage
properties.description: The politically-charged historical drama of Richard II follows the fall of King Richard of England and the rise of his successor, Henry Bolingbroke, as the two battle for the 13th century English throne. The play weaves together the histories of these two figures with rich poetry and disruptive political themes to create a tapestry like no other in Shakespeare's works. Briefly banned in Shakespeare’s lifetime for hitting too close to home, Richard remains an achingly relevant chronicle, and a captivating glimpse into the rise and fall of kings.

properties.title: Jul  7, 2010: A Midsummer Night's Dream at H-B Woodlawn Mainstage
properties.description: Perhaps the most celebrated comedy penned by William Shakespeare, A Midsummer Night’s Dream has been and will certainly remain an audience favorite. But beyond its reputation, the play is a stunning comic masterpiece, a spectacular voyage through fantasy, love, and farce. The story tracks the intertwined lives of four reckless Athenian lovers, a group of “rude mechanicals” desperate for theatrical success, and the supernatural world of the warring Fairy King and Queen. Bound to please, Midsummer is a plunge into a wild, rich, Shakespearean dream not to be missed.

properties.title: Jul 22, 2010: Health Fair and Blood Drive at Crystal Square
properties.description:
Join the Crystal City BID for Crystal City's Health Day!  The health fair and blood drive will take place on Crystal Drive between 18th and 20th Street (the same location as the farmers' market).
Inova Blood Donation Services will be present with their bloodmobile to help willing participants donate blood and save lives.  Blood donation will take place from 10:30AM - 2:30PM; reservations are not required but strongly encouraged.  Register online with Inova to set up an appointment.  All willing participants who complete the registration process will receive a free banner bag from the Crystal City BID!
The majority of the health fair will occur from 11AM - 2PM with several health booths and screenings.  The following will be featured from Inova Health Systems:
    * Blood Pressure
    * Body Composition
    * Dermaview Facial Skin Screening
    * Body Mass Index Assessment
    * Ask the Nutritionist
    * Tobacco Cessation & Carbon Monoxide Screening
    * Stress Booth
Sport & Health will also sponsor blood pressure, body composition, and movement analysis screenings.  Their resident chiropractor, Dr. Holt, will also be present with his massage therapist providing both postural screenings and chair massages.  And don't miss the fitness class demonstrations from Sport & Health's popular group fitness instructors!
Body Rays will sponsor chair massages at their booth with their popular massage therapist. 
Get ready for the Crystal City Twilighter just two days after the health fair with Pacers Running Store's booth featuring gait analysis.
Crystal City Chiropractic will also be present at the health fair.
The event will be held rain or shine.

properties.title: Nov 17, 2010: Legal Writing for Non-Lawyers, November 2010 at George Mason University (ARLINGTON CAMPUS)
properties.description: COURSE FEE: $660.00                                               COURSE OBJECTIVES - Distinguish legal writing from other writing styles. Understand legal writing formats.Apply legal rules in a persuasive document.Explain commonly used legal terms and phrases.Incorporate a plain English writing style in legal documents. AGENDA - Introduction to Legal Writing Legal Formats and the Legal MethodStandard components of a legal document.Briefs, decisions, and other documents employing a legal format. Understanding and Applying Legal RulesWriting Exercise: Developing sound legal arguments Legal Terms and PhrasesWriting Exercise.  Legal Authorities and Citations WHY ATTEND? Many federal employees must read, understand, or respond to legal documents. These include letters, briefs, and position statements written by attorneys, as well as administrative and judicial decisions. In addition, many employees are responsible for drafting or editing federal regulations and understanding decisions issued by judges, arbitrators, and other administrative bodies. In this course, attendees will learn how to decipher legal jargon, locate and identify the key components in a brief or decision, and better understand legal citations. Through hands-on writing exercises, seminar participants will sharpen their legal writing skills and apply a plain English approach to crafting persuasive legal documents. COMMENTS OF STUDENTS WHO HAVE ATTENDED OTHER COURSES BY DON RIDER:........  Instructor was very knowledgeable and interesting, gave us lots of good information. ........  Great writing exercises, can apply to real work experiences. ........  Engages students by participation and encouragement. ........  Great handouts - good references ........  Course very useful and will help in performing duties. ........  Would recommend GRA courses and this course to others. NOTE:   A list of hotels is provided during your registration. INSTRUCTOR - MR. DON RIDER, J.D.Mr. Rider has 30 years of experience in the Federal Sector union-management relations. He is an expert labor and employment law counselor and author of many labor and human resource articles and books. He is a frequent speaker at Human Resource Conferences. Mr. Rider has served as Chief Negotiator or Deputy Chief Negotiator for more than 8 major term agreements. A seasoned arbitration advocate, Mr. Rider has also represented agencies in mediation, unfair labor practices, and before the Federal Service Impasses Panel. Mr. Rider currently serves as a faculty member at the University of Maryland University College and has 18-plus years of experience developing and delivering classroom-based and online education (DE) courses and seminars for the adult learner.             Click the following link to register this event: Register powered by RegOnline

properties.title: Nov 13, 2010: Reaction and First Step for Athletes of All Levels- Fitness First Arlington at Fitness First Arlington 883802
properties.description: SAQ -Improving Your Neurological Function, Speed, and EfficiencyInstructor: Khalid McLeod, M.S., CCS, Personal Trainer, & Nutrition Consultant  This class is designed to teach the athlete how to become a more explosive, powerful, and elusive runner. With this, there are 4 major concepts that we like to go over in the class for the athlete: 1) Dynamic Warm-up: Getting the athlete ready for competition in a non-static fashion, simply by moving kinestically through space. 2) Form Run Techniques: Taking the athlete's natural gait and breaking it down systematically to make him/her more efficient with each step. 3)The Strength Component: which is needed to assist the athlete with generating more power in their 1st Step and beyond. 4) Ploymetrics and Agility: which is a very important component for the athlete, in terms of controlling that explosiveness and then utiliziing and controlling it in a dynamic way so the individual becomes an overall better athlete. 8 CEUs Click the following link to register this event: Register powered by RegOnline

properties.title: Nov  6, 2010: Stories of Transformation...A Glimpse of India at Westin Arlington Gateway Hotel 801 N. Glebe Rd. Arlington, VA
properties.description: Join us on November 6, 2010 at 6:30pm for dinner and learn how Five Talents is bringing hope to people living in some of the most remote and risky areas of the world. Five Talents provides access to microcredit programs, business skills training and spiritual development, because a primary reason for a rural family’s inability to escape poverty is their lack of access to financial resources. In December 2004, the devastating tsunami that hit Southeast Asia did not spare the rural fishing villages of South India. Within minutes of the waves crashing to shore, livelihoods were destroyed and hopes smashed. No more boats, no more nets, no way to make a living. However, despite being haunted by memories of the catastrophe, it was unthinkable for the villagers to leave – these rural villages and ocean shores had been home for generations. In response to this tragedy, Five Talents started a Self-Help Group program and within a year more than 500 women had access to training and loans as small as $33 to start new businesses! This was nearly five years ago and is just one example of Five Talents’ work worldwide! Today, there are more than 3,400 women in this program. By empowering these women, children are now attending school, husbands are encouraged and communities have been transformed in ways never imagined before the tsunami! RSVP by Friday, October 29 at (703) 242-6016 or FiveTalentsEvents@FiveTalents.org.

properties.title: Oct 16, 2010: "Save the Arlington Planetarium" benefit at Washington-Lee High School
properties.description: STARS COME OUT FOR ARLINGTON’S PLANETARIUM on Saturday, October 16, 2010 from 7:30 to 10:00 p.m. at the Washington-Lee High School Auditorium, located at 1301 N. Stafford St. in Arlington VA. Doors open at 7 p.m. Top-notch indie & eclectic performance groups guarantee guests a sparkling musical extravaganza that benefits the renovation of Arlington’s David M. Brown Planetarium. Congressman Jim Moran and former NASA astronaut, Bill Readdy are scheduled to speak. Ray Anderson, former HB Woodlawn Principal, will emcee the event. This community-based fundraiser show-cases local Arlington performing groups & is billed as a rollicking good time for everyone. Performing groups include Yorktown Yahoos, Arlington’s Children’s Spanish Chorus, HB Woodlawn Teachers, Arlingtones’ Barbershop Quartet, Frau Eva (http://www.myspace.com/frauevamusic), and Koshari (http://www.myspace.com/koshari ; http://www.kosharimusic.com/). The Yorktown Yahoos will be on-stage welcoming early arrivals with their Bluegrass tunes at 7:15 p.m. View the October sky through a telescope before and after the show (weather permitting), purchase a “Save the Arlington Planetarium” T-shirt, and (with luck) win a door prize. Plenty of free onsite parking in the county parking deck/garage adjacent to W-L High School. Enter the building through Entrance #1 (main entrance) or Entrance #5 (nearest to the parking garage). Suggested donations: Adults $15; Students $5; Children Free (12 & younger). Sponsored by the non-profit organization Friends of Arlington’s David M. Brown Planetarium. http://www.saveplanetarium.org Details: http://www.saveplanetarium.org/2010/09/29/stars-come-out-for-arlingtons-planetarium-at-october-16th-benefit-concert/ Contact Person: Alice Monet, Board Presidentalicemonet@gmail.com (703) 626-6101

Apr  5, 2011: CON 100: Shaping Smart Business Arrangements at Arlington Court Suites Hotel
properties.description: Acquisition workforce employees who are beginning a level I certification program are required to take CON 100. Employees pursuing Level II or Level III certifications may consider taking CON 100 as an elective. This DAU-equivalent course fulfills this requirement. Upon completion of the course, attendees will be able to: * Recognize the priorities and focus of their agency’s senior leadership * Conduct the business of government as a member of the acquisition team * Make smart business decisions on behalf of the taxpayer * Operate within current laws, consistent with public policy * Support customers and stakeholders During this course students will participate in discussions and have learning experiences related to the following major topics: * Senior leadership‘s vision and focus for the acquisition mission and workforce * The expected approach to supporting the agency mission and customers * The expected approach to conducting business in a smart way * The preferences for conducting business and meeting needs through smart business practices * The overarching principles defining and guiding the agency approach to doing business as Government contracting professionals This course is equivalent to DAU CON100 Shaping Smart Business Arrangements.Click the following link to register this event: Register powered by RegOnline

properties.title: Jan 25, 2011: Introduction to FAR - Federal Acquisition Regulation Overview at Arlington Court Suites Hotel
properties.description: Introduction to FAR is intended for students interested in gaining a basic understanding of how to most effectively use the Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR). Although the FAR is a very detailed and complex regulation, contracting parties in the federal Government marketplace must know the terms and conditions of the contracts they enter into. This course will improve the ability of students to select the right clauses, identify the correct procedures and improve their bargaining position during negotiations. In addition, students will learn how to keep up with changes to the FAR so they can always be sure that they have the latest and most relevant information. Rather than using a text book about the FAR, each student will receive a personal copy of the FAR which will be used as the course manual. This approach ensures that students will become familiar with the source document, which will enable them to immediately apply the knowledge they gain through this informative three-day session.Click the following link to register this event: Register powered by RegOnline

properties.title: Feb  1, 2011: GAO's Principles of Federal Appropriations Law at Arlington Court Suites Hotel
properties.description: In 1982, GAO released the first edition of Principles of Federal Appropriations Law – a collection of the body of law governing the expenditure of federal funds commonly known as the Red Book. Today, agency program managers, general counsel, contracts administrators and financial officers are all faced with significant challenges in meeting organization needs within current budgets. What are the rules? How are they applied in practice? What are the typical mistakes made that result in wasted or lost funds? How can an agency protect its budget? How can an agency manager maximize their allocation? The rules governing federal appropriations are complex, extensive and fill four binders. This course, taught by leading experts in government contract law, will provide the student with an overview of the rules, how they are applied, and most importantly, how to maximize funds with budget limits AND within the rules. Learn precisely how the Federal government’s budget and spending system works – and how to avoid impasses at each phase in the process, from initial planning through ultimate disbursement.Click the following link to register this event: Register powered by RegOnline

properties.title: Nov  2, 2010: Nov 2 Cafe Scientifique Arlington at Atrium at FrontPage Restaurant & NSF building
properties.description: CAFÉ SCIENTIFIQUE ARLINGTON WHAT: The silent, but giant global energy transition WHEN: Tuesday, November 2 program begins at 6:15 PM. Come early to order food and drinks. WHERE: The Front Page Restaurant, 4201 Wilson Blvd., Arlington, VA, located near Ballston Metro on the ground floor of the NSF building. Parking is available under the NSF Building or at Ballston Common Mall. WHO: Joris D. Benninga, Founding Partner, Real NewEnergy Company, an integrated sustainable energy company located in the Netherlands and Virginia. HOW: 5:30 p.m. Special half price burgers; please come early to order table service and socialize. Presentation begins at 6:15 p.m. followed by Q&A No science background required, only interest! Free and open to the public Registration required www.arlingtonvirginiausa.com/bsta ABOUT THE TOPIC: Sufficient affordable energy is of paramount importance. Without it, complex societies like ours can't exist. Yet we generally take its availability for granted. Only in times of crises do we cry out for change, but only briefly. So it may seem that not a lot is changing. But actually the energy transition towards a more sustainable system is in full swing and many scientific developments are entering the business realm. Alternative energy supply options are becoming competitive very fast. Energy efficiency tools and regulations are becoming standard elements in virtually every value chain. Benninga will discuss a number of practical developments comparing recent European and US experiences. He will take us out to sea to explore the developing concepts of Ocean Energy and back on land with a couple of energy technologies and solutions that make a lot of sense and are available right now! SUPPORT THIS CAFE: The Ballston Science and Technology Alliance, a nonprofit organization, is the sponsor of Café Scientifique Arlington. Since April 2006, the goal of Café Scientifique has been to make science more accessible and accountable by featuring speakers whose expertise spans the sciences and who can talk in plain English. Café is held each month on first Tuesdays at the Front Page in Arlington. Please go to www.arlingtonvirginiausa.com/bsta and contribute. Help keep Café open and free to all! COMING NEXT MONTH: December 7, Your Brain: Use it or Lose it by Dr. Mark Matteson, Chief of the Laboratory of Neurosciences at the National Institute on Aging For more information contact Kaye Breen, ballstonscience@yahoo.com , visit www.arlingtonvirginiausa.com/bsta or join us on twitter: http://twitter.com/sciencecafeva or facebook http://www.facebook.com/pages/Ballston-Science-and-Technology-Alliance/116954825970, or our blog at http://bsta.wordpress.com.

Departure Location: Bailey's Pub & Grille: 4238 Wilson Blvd. Arlington, VA; 703-465-1300; www.foxandhound.com (Ballston Metro, Orange Line) Please note, no tickets will be sent to you. You will receive a confirmation email with your ticket purchase and a trip detail reminder will be sent to you as well. No refunds; rain or shine. Tubing will last about 4 hours, it depends on river speed and how long you linger on the river. No glass or flip flops allowed. Remember to bring sunscreen and sunglasses. One free cooler tube per 4 people, they will hold a standard size cooler (12-18 cans), no Styrofoam allowed. You can rent additional cooler tubes and floating coolers from Front Royal Canoe. For more information on Front Royal Canoe, please visit their website at frontroyalcanoe.com/ . Please email trips@ontaponline.com with any questions. Cheers and see you on the river!
